attachments.fallback: [January 9th, 2017 10:14 PM] baohua: suggest we at least keep some searchable info (gerrit id/email) at the maintainer.txt, this is helpful when people wanna find who is the developer of the projects, and especially to invite as reviewers.
attachments.text: suggest we at least keep some searchable info (gerrit id/email) at the maintainer.txt, this is helpful when people wanna find who is the developer of the projects, and especially to invite as reviewers.

text: Will be happy to add another column or two. Any objections?
jonathanlevi if you do that, could you order them alphabetically on some column? I'd prefer gerrit ID or github ID but first or last name would be fine
<@U0UHG4VP1>: Sure thing, I’m happy with *gerrit ID*, as you prefer.
<@U11MANG9G> I'm editing it since I have information you don't
I will put together a proposal for review (here)
I realized after I said that
First thing is to agree on the columns - filling the data/info should be straight forward (we all know people who know people here ;-))
I don't understand the need, can you explain the idea baohua suggests?
here is a first pass for me: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3795/> it is ordered in the same way it's ordered in the LDAP UI
jonathanlevi do you think a note about cr-fabric is worth adding? or does anyone use cr-fabric?
<@U0ZJZBJLF>: Sure, can you take a look at my review comments? (adding more “contact details”, making it easier to find/reach out to a maintainer)
<@U0UHG4VP1>: I personally don’t feel we need a note re: *cr-fabric* (at this point). Unless others really want to have it - please let us know.
OK. I think I am done goofing with it. I changed the column order.
Thanks again Ry. Those who agree - let’s go with a `+1` so that we can get <@U0PB67X4K>, <@U0KM61BCP>, <@U0KPFAZNF>, <@U0XQ35CDD>, <@U0ZJZBJLF>, … to vote as well.
looks good
I also need to update my email address
I set them to what they are in LDAP
+1 and (oops) I already merged 3795
<@U0KM61BCP>: good morning :wink: :coffee:
howdy
Good, good… I woke up too early here.
